intro: Brasilaelia virens, commonly known as the green bell tree, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Brazil. It is characterized by its broad, glossy green leaves and clusters of fragrant white flowers that bloom throughout the year. The plant is part of the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 12,000 species of flowering plants. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for ornamental gardening and as a houseplant. The tree is also notable for its ability to thrive in a variety of soil types and its relatively low maintenance requirements.
